p: Our findings may also differ from those of extant experimental work due to sample dissimilarities. While Aklin and Urpelainen [ 16] Petrovic et al. [ 15], Myers et al. [ 18], and Severson and Coleman [ 19] also use random samples of American adults, Kahan et al. [ 11] examine individuals from both the U.S. and England, Yarnal et al. [ 13] only sample individuals from central Pennsylvania, Schuldt et al. [ 14] use respondents who routinely complete a monthly 30-minute survey session as part of the University of Michigan Survey of Consumer Attitudes, and Wiest et al. [ 20] use a sample of university students.
